title: When my husband died, I felt a secret sense of relief
text:
I’ll never forget the moment, 15 years ago, that my husband Colin was diagnosed with a rare degenerative brain condition. It felt like we’d been run over by a steamroller. But beyond the shock and concern for him, I also remember worrying about my new role as his carer – I had no idea how I was going to do it. It felt completely overwhelming.

Colin and I met at work 25 years ago – he was my manager and three decades older than me, but that didn’t bother us. We had both been through difficult relationships and I fell for his kind heart and sense of humour. He loved my two daughters as though they were his own and when we had our daughter, our family felt complete.

The age gap made no difference...
